The crude product was purified by column chromatography (silica, CH2Cl2, and then 9:1 diethyl ether/petroleum ether). The solvent was removed under reduced pressure to give 1 as a yellow solid. Yield: 510 mg (75%). Anal. Calcd for C28H24N2O⋅0.5H2O: C, 81.33; H, 6.09; N, 6.77. Found: C, 81.03; H, 6.34; N, 6.45. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 8.79 (d, 4 J = 2.1 Hz, 1H, Ha), 7.88 (dd, 3 J = 8.1 Hz, 4 J = 2.1 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.49 (d, 3 J = 8.1 Hz, 1H, Hc), 7.45 (d, 3 J = 8.7 Hz, 2H, He), 7.29 (td, 3 J = 7.5 Hz, 4J = 1.7 Hz, 4H, Hh), 7.11-7.17 (m, 6H, Hf, Hg), 7.08 (t, 3 J = 7.3 Hz, 2H, Hi), 1.66 (s, 6H, Hd). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 148.5, 147.7, 147.4, 140.7, 135.5, 133.9, 130.2, 129.5, 127.8, 127.1, 125.0, 123.6, 123.4, 94.8, 81.5, 65.6, 31.4. HRESI-MS (CH2Cl2). Calcd for C28H25N2O+: m/z 405.1961 ([1 + H]+). Found: m/z 405.1961. IR (ATR): ν 3032 (w, OH), 2921, 2112 (w, CC), 1587, 1486, 1274, 835, 754, 694, 518 cm-1.

4-(6-Ethynylpyridin-3-yl)-N,N-diphenylaniline (2)

Compound 1 (260 mg, 0.643 mmol, 1 equiv) was dissolved in toluene (25 mL). Crushed KOH powder (217 mg, 3.87 mmol, 6 equiv) was then added. The resulting mixture was stirred at 80 °C for 20 min. The unreacted KOH was filtered through Celite and washed with CH2Cl2 (2 × 10 mL). The filtrate was washed with water (3 × 50 mL) and then brine (3 × 50 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The product was passed through a plug of silica (eluent: 4:1 diethyl ether/petroleum ether). The solvent was removed under reduced pressure to give 2 as a yellow solid. Yield: 192 mg (86%). Anal. Calcd for C25H18N2: C, 86.68; H, 5.24; N, 8.09. Found: C, 86.17; H, 5.48; N, 7.79. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 8.81 (s, 1H, Ha), 7.82 (dd, 3 J = 8.1 Hz, 4J = 2.2 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.52 (d, 3 J = 8.2 Hz, 1H, Hc), 7.45 (d, 3 J = 8.8 Hz, 2H, He), 7.26-7.32 (m, 4H, Hh), 7.11-7.17 (m, 6H, Hf, Hg), 7.07 (t, 3 J = 7.3 Hz, 2H, Hi), 3.19 (s, 1H, Hd). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 148.6, 147.9, 147.4, 140.0, 136.1, 134.0, 130.0, 129.6, 127.9, 127.6, 125.0, 123.7, 123.4, 82.7, 78.1. HRESI-MS (CH2Cl2). Calcd for C25H18N2Na+: m/z 369.1362 ([2 + Na]+). Found: m/z 369.1348. Calcd for C25H19N2 +: m/z 347.1543 ([2 + H]+). Found: m/z 347.1532. IR (ATR): ν 3284 (w, CCH), 3056, 3032, 1586, 1474, 1325, 1279, 826, 756, 696, 621 cm-1. Orange crystals of 2 suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by vapor diffusion of petroleum ether into a CH2Cl2 solution of 2.

4-[6-(1-Benzyl-1H-1,2,3-triazol-4-yl)pyridin-3-yl]-N,N-diphenylaniline (TPA-pytri)

Degassed 4:1 DMF/H2O (20 mL) was added to a mixture of 2 (214 mg, 0.618 mmol, 1 equiv), NaN3 (48 mg, 0.74 mmol, 1.2 equiv), l-ascorbic acid (109 mg, 0.619 mmol, 1 equiv), Na2CO3 (66 mg, 0.62 mmol, 1 equiv), and CuSO4⋅5H2O (77 mg, 0.31 mmol, 0.5 equiv). The resulting suspension was stirred and degassed with nitrogen gas for 10 min. Benzyl bromide (116 mg, 0.678 mmol, 1.1 equiv) was added to the suspension, and the reaction mixture was heated at 65 °C for 21 h. The reaction mixture was cooled to room temperature. CH2Cl2 (100 mL) and then aqueous 0.1 M EDTA/NH4OH (50 mL) were added to the reaction mixture. The organic layer was washed with aqueous 0.1 M EDTA/NH4OH (50 mL), then water (3 × 100 mL), and brine (3 × 100 mL) and dried over Na2SO4, and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (silica, CH2Cl2, and then 2:1 diethyl ether/petroleum ether). The solvent was removed under reduced pressure to give compound TPA-pytri as a yellow solid. Yield: 242 mg (82%). Anal. Calcd for C32H25N5: C, 80.14; H, 5.25; N, 14.60. Found: C, 79.81; H, 5.43; N, 14.77. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 8.75 (d, 4 J = 2.3 Hz, 1H, Ha), 8.21 (d, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 1H, Hc), 8.05 (s, 1H, Hd), 7.94 (dd, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 4 J = 2.3 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.47 (d, 3 J = 8.6 Hz, 2H, Hi), 7.33-7.40 (m, 4H, Hf, Hg), 7.26-7.31 (m, 5H, Hh, Hl), 7.12-7.17 (m, 6H, Hj, Hk), 7.06 (t, 3 J = 7.3 Hz, 2H, Hm), 5.60 (s, 2H, He). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CDCl3): δ 148.8, 148.5, 148.2, 147.6, 147.4, 135.4, 134.7, 134.5, 131.0, 129.5, 129.3, 129.0, 128.5, 127.7, 124.9, 123.7, 123.5, 121.9, 120.3, 54.6. HRESI-MS (CHCl3). Calcd for C32H25N5Na+: m/z 502.2002 ([TPA-pytri + Na]+). Found: m/z 502.1984. IR (ATR): ν 3031, 2951, 1587, 1486, 1274, 824, 753, 695, 521 cm-1. Solid K2CO3 was added to deuterated chloroform. The supernatant was added to compound TPA-pytri and gave a yellow solution. Yellow crystals of TPA-pytri and KOH adducts (TPA-pytri⋅KOH) suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by vapor diffusion of petroleum ether into this yellow solution.

[Ru(TPA-pytri)(bpy)2](PF6)2⋅H2O

 cis-[Ru(bpy)2Cl2] (104 mg, 0.22 mmol, 1 equiv) and ligand TPA-pytri (10 mg, 0.22 mmol, 1 equiv) were dissolved in ethanol (15 mL). The resulting solution was degassed with argon for 10 min and then heated at 125 °C in a microwave (200 W) for 1 h. The resulting orange solution was cooled to room temperature. A saturated aqueous solution of NH4PF6 (20 mL) was added dropwise to the solution to afford the PF6 - salt as an orange precipitate. The precipitate was collected by filtration, washed with water, ethanol, and diethyl ether, and dried under vacuum. The crude product was purified via vapor diffusion of diisopropyl ether into an acetonitrile solution of the crude product to give orange crystals of [Ru(TPA-pytri)(bpy)2](PF6)2 suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis. Yield: 172 mg (88%). Anal. Calcd for C52H41F12N9P2Ru⋅H2O: C, 52.01; H, 3.61; N, 10.50. Found: C, 51.93; H, 3.61; N, 10.74. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CD3CN): δ 8.58 (s, 1H, Hd), 8.47-8.52 (m, 2H, bpyH), 8.41-8.47 (m, 2H, bpyH), 8.15 (dd, 3 J = 8.4 Hz, 4 J = 2.0 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.99-8.09 (m, 5H, Hc, bpyH), 7.87-7.94 (m, 3H, bpyH), 7.74 (d, 3 J = 5.6 Hz, 1H, bpyH), 7.61 (d, 4 J = 1.6 Hz, 1H, Ha), 7.43-7.47 (m, 1H, bpyH), 7.36-7.43 (m, 5H, Hg, Hh, bpyH), 7.30-7.36 (m, 5H, Hl, bpyH), 7.20 (d, 3 J = 8.8 Hz, 2H, Hi), 7.11-7.18 (m, 4H, Hf, Hm), 7.04-7.09 (m, 4H, Hk), 6.94 (d, 3 J = 8.8 Hz, 2H, Hj), 5.54 and 5.52 (ABq, 2 J = 15 Hz, 2H, He). 13C NMR (125 MHz, CD3CN): δ 158.7, 158.4, 158.2, 158.0, 153.3, 153.2, 153.1, 153.0, 150.2, 149.4, 149.1, 148.8, 147.9, 138.9, 138.8, 138.8, 138.7, 138.6, 136.1, 134.7, 130.7, 130.1, 130.0, 129.2, 128.6, 128.6, 128.5, 128.4, 128.2, 127.7, 126.4, 126.3, 125.4, 125.3, 125.3, 124.8, 124.5, 123.6, 122.7, 56.5. HRESI-MS (acetone). Calcd for C52H41N9Ru2+: m/z 446.6266 ([Ru(TPA-pytri)(bpy)2]2+). Found: m/z 446.6289. IR (ATR): ν 3076, 1586, 1512, 1488, 1461, 826 (s, PF6 -), 763, 728, 701, 555 (m, PF6 -) cm-1.

 fac-[Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br]

Ethanol (20 mL) was added to a mixture of ligand TPA-pytri (210 mg, 0.438 mmol, 1 equiv) and [Re(CO)5Br] (178 mg, 0.438 mmol, 1 equiv). The resulting solution was heated at reflux in the absence of light for 24 h. The volume of the solvent was reduced to approximately 10 mL, and the resulting solution was cooled at 4 °C for 2 h. Complex fac-[Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br] precipitated as a tan-yellow solid, which was collected by filtration. The product was dissolved in CH2Cl2, and the resulting solution was washed with water (2 × 100 mL) and brine (2 × 100 mL) and then dried over Na2SO4. The solvent was removed under reduced pressure to give fac-[Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br] as a tan-yellow solid. Yield: 232 mg (64%). Anal. Calcd for C35H25BrN5O3: C, 50.67; H, 3.04; N, 8.44. Found: C, 50.77; H, 3.14; N, 8.42. 1H NMR (400 MHz, DMSO-d 6): δ 9.27 (s, 1H, Hd), 9.05 (d, 4 J = 2.1 Hz, 1H, Ha), 8.53 (dd, 3 J = 8.4 Hz, 4 J = 2.1 Hz, 1H, Hb), 8.37 (d, 3 J = 8.4 Hz, 1H, Hc), 7.77 (d, 3 J = 8.7 Hz, 2H, Hi), 7.40-7.49 (m, 5H, Hf, Hg, Hh), 7.33-7.40 (m, 4H, Hl), 7.06-7.16 (m, 8H, Hj, Hk, Hm), 5.92 (s, 2H, He). 13C NMR (125 MHz, DMSO-d 6): δ 149.7, 148.6, 148.4, 146.6, 146.6, 137.4, 137.3, 134.1, 129.7, 129.1, 128.9, 128.5, 128.2, 127.2, 125.7, 124.8, 124.0, 122.8, 122.4, 54.8. HRESI-MS (CH2Cl2). Calcd for C35H25BrN5NaO3Re+: m/z 852.0574 ([Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br + Na]+). Found: m/z 852.0601. IR (ATR): ν 3093, 2023 (s, CO), 1922 (s, CO), 1883 (s, CO), 1587, 1487, 1471, 1287, 1262, 832, 694 cm-1. Yellow crystals of [Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br] suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by vapor diffusion of diisopropyl ether into an acetone solution of [Re(TPA-pytri)(CO)3Br].

[Pt(TPA-pytri)Cl2]

Methanol (45 mL) was added to a mixture of cis-[Pt(DMSO)2Cl2] (290 mg, 0.687 mmol, 1 equiv) and ligand TPA-pytri (345 mg, 0.719 mmol, 1.05 equiv). The resulting suspension was heated at reflux for 1 h and then cooled to room temperature. [Pt(TPA-pytri)Cl2] precipitated as an orange solid, which was collected by filtration, washed with methanol and then diethyl ether, and dried under vacuum. Yield: 414 mg (81%). Anal. Calcd for C32H25Cl2N5Pt: C, 51.55; H, 3.38; N, 9.39. Found: C, 51.51; H, 3.58; N, 9.23. 1H NMR (500 MHz, CDCl3): δ 9.30 (d, 4 J = 1.8 Hz, 1H, Ha), 8.28 (s, 1H, Hd), 7.99 (dd, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 4 J = 1.8 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.80 (d, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 1H, Hc), 7.48-7.55 (m, 2H, Hf), 7.41-7.47 (m, 3H, Hg, Hh), 7.21-7.26 (m, 4H, Hl), 7.17 (d, 3 J = 8.7 Hz, 2H, Hi), 7.09 (t, 3J = 7.4 Hz, 2H, Hm), 7.03 (d, 3 J = 7.6 Hz, 4H, Hk), 6.96 (d, 3 J = 8.7 Hz, 2H, Hj), 5.68 (s, 2H, He). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 149.6, 148.7, 146.7, 146.2, 146.2, 137.6, 135.4, 132.2, 129.9, 129.7, 129.7, 129.7, 127.6, 126.2, 125.6, 125.3, 124.4, 122.5, 121.8, 57.0. HRESI-MS (CH2Cl2). Calcd for C32H25Cl2N5NaPt+: m/z 767.1030 ([Pt(TPA-pytri)Cl2 + Na]+). Found: m/z 767.1055. IR (ATR): ν 3058, 1588, 1487, 1327, 1283, 822, 752, 727, 694 cm-1.

[Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2]

Dry deaerated CH2Cl2 (42 mL) was added to a mixture of [Pt(TPA-pytri)Cl2] (187 mg, 0.251 mmol, 1 equiv), copper(I) iodide (10 mg, 0.053 mmol, 0.2 equiv), and phenylacetylene (381 mg, 3.73 mmol, 15 equiv). The resulting mixture was degassed with nitrogen gas for 10 min. Triethylamine (3 mL) was then added, and the reaction mixture was stirred at room temperature under a nitrogen atmosphere for 66 h. CH2Cl2 (20 mL) was added to the reaction mixture. The resulting solution was washed with aqueous 0.1 M EDTA/NH4OH (2 × 40 mL), then water (3 × 50 mL), and brine (2 × 100 mL). The organic layer was dried over Na2SO4, and the solvent was removed under reduced pressure. The crude product was purified by column chromatography (silica, CH2Cl2, and then 19:1 CH2Cl2/acetone). The solvent was reduced to approximately 1 mL, and diethyl ether was then added. The solvent was removed under reduced pressure to give complex [Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2] as a tan-yellow solid. Yield: 130 mg (59%). Anal. Calcd for C48H35N5Pt⋅0.1CH2Cl2: C, 65.25; H, 4.01; N, 7.91. Found: C, 65.12; H, 4.06; N, 7.67. 1H NMR (400 MHz, CDCl3): δ 9.49 (s, 1H, Ha), 8.42 (s, 1H, Hd), 7.81 (d, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 1H, Hc), 7.75 (d, 3 J = 8.3 Hz, 1H, Hb), 7.55 (d, 3 J = 7.4 Hz, 2H, Hn or Hq), 7.41 (d, 3 J = 7.0 Hz, 2H, Hn or Hq), 7.17-7.32 (m, 11H, Hf, Hg, Hh, Hl, Ho or Hr), 7.06-7.17 (m, 8H, Hi, Hm, Ho or Hr, Hp, Hs), 7.02 (d, 3 J = 7.8 Hz, 4H, Hk), 6.89 (d, 3 J = 8.6 Hz, 2H, Hj), 5.47 (s, 2H, He). 13C NMR (100 MHz, CDCl3): δ 149.1, 149.0, 147.5, 146.9, 146.1, 137.4, 135.1, 133.0, 132.5, 132.1, 129.6, 129.2, 129.2, 128.5, 128.4, 128.2, 128.1, 128.0, 127.6, 127.2, 125.7, 125.7, 125.4, 125.2, 124.2, 122.7, 122.0, 102.2, 101.2, 56.1. HRESI-MS (CH2Cl2). Calcd for C48H35N5NaPt+: m/z 899.2436 ([Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2 + Na]+). Found: m/z 899.2517. Calcd for C48H36N5NaPt+: m/z 877.2617 ([Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2 + H]+). Found: m/z 877.2645. IR (ATR): ν 3032, 2109 (m, CC), 1586, 1484, 1325, 1270, 820, 750, 690 cm-1. Yellow crystals of [Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2] suitable for X-ray crystallographic analysis were obtained by vapor diffusion of petroleum ether into a CHCl3 solution of [Pt(TPA-pytri)(CCPh)2].
